See [this](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/15087/gazebo5-specular-in-material-does-not-work/) question.

The specular element in SDF is not working, but ambient, diffuse and emissive do.

A way to test this is to insert the following model in an empty world:

~~~
<?xml version='1.0'?>
<sdf version='1.6'>
<model name='materials'>
  <static>true</static>
  <link name="ambient">
    <pose>0 1 0 0 0 0</pose>
    <visual name="visual">
      <material>
        <ambient>0 0 1 1</ambient>
        <diffuse>0 0 0 1</diffuse>
        <emissive>0 0 0 1</emissive>
        <specular>0 0 0 1</specular>
      </material>
      <geometry>
        <sphere>
          <radius>0.1</radius>
        </sphere>
      </geometry>
    </visual>
  </link>
  <link name="diffuse">
    <pose>1 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
    <visual name="visual">
      <material>
        <ambient>0 0 0 1</ambient>
        <diffuse>0 0 1 1</diffuse>
        <emissive>0 0 0 1</emissive>
        <specular>0 0 0 1</specular>
      </material>
      <geometry>
        <sphere>
          <radius>0.1</radius>
        </sphere>
      </geometry>
    </visual>
  </link>
  <link name="emissive">
    <pose>0 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
    <visual name="visual">
      <material>
        <ambient>0 0 0 1</ambient>
        <diffuse>0 0 0 1</diffuse>
        <emissive>0 0 1 1</emissive>
        <specular>0 0 0 1</specular>
      </material>
      <geometry>
        <sphere>
          <radius>0.1</radius>
        </sphere>
      </geometry>
    </visual>
  </link>
  <link name="specular">
    <pose>1 1 0 0 0 0</pose>
    <visual name="visual">
      <material>
        <ambient>0 0 0 1</ambient>
        <diffuse>0 0 0 1</diffuse>
        <emissive>0 0 0 1</emissive>
        <specular>0 0 1 1</specular>
      </material>
      <geometry>
        <sphere>
          <radius>0.1</radius>
        </sphere>
      </geometry>
    </visual>
  </link>
</model>
</sdf>
~~~

1. Then on the left panel, set the `sun`'s diffuse and specular to black. Set the `Scene`'s ambient to black.

1. Only the `emissive` link is visible.

1. Set the `sun`'s specular to white, nothing changes

1. Set the `sun`'s diffuse to white, the diffuse link turns blue

1. Set the `Scene`'s ambient to white, the ambient link turns blue
